availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frank Struck (Jefferson County, KY, flour dealer & grocer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, retail grocer and flour dealer. Native of Prussia. Married to Lena Hert Struck. Father of John Struck and Frank Struck. Grocer in Louisville in 1850. Retail grocer in Louisville in 1859. Signed a petition as a flour dealer in May 1861 to appoint W. G. Timberlake as flour inspector. Grocer in Jefferson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 312B.

Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 5th Congressional District, Vol. 3, July 1863, p. 457, (Accessed via ancestry.com on January 27, 2020).
